Posts.Content: Oct 13, 2012 01:51PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Hi.  This is my first post.  I was diagnosed 9/21/12 and this board has been a godsend.  I am scheduled for a BMX on 10/25 with TE reconstruction.  I am so frightened.  My BC center does not do tests for mets unless there are symptoms, and the sentinal node biopsy is done at the time of surgery.  So I have not been staged yet.  The waiting is just awful, but I am thankful that I have a surgery date, 5 weeks since diagnosis.  I am 45 and all of my 5 prior mammograms never picked up my 2.9 cm ILC.  It was only diagnosed by MRI and biopsy (after I felt a thickening in the shower).  Hang in there all October surgery gals! Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2012 04:30AM Wendymartha1 wrote: CindyLooWho and Paula and other recent surgery gals - you are on the other side now!  Congratulations for getting through surgery and thank you for reporting out.  You are in my thoughts for terrific healing and pain-free days. Mgdsmc - hang in there.  You are a day after me.  I wanted to tell you that you must have a great PS.  My PS would not perform a proceedure that would last more than 4-5 hours.  He said it was too fatiguing for him.  So I am doing tissue expander reconstruction.  But just think of what a beautiful recon job you are getting!  You won't even know that 10 hours has passed you by! Wendy  Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2012 06:14PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Hello Martha and other lovely ladies, I'm sorry we all have to be here.  I sure hope we will be fine!  I am trying to keep a positive frame of mind but it is hard . Today I did some shopping for the big surgery day to include things like a recliner chair, stool softener, zip up bra, electric tooth brush, button up shirts, cup with a long straw, and throat drops.  It couldn't be soon enough!  Martha in my user name is my nick name.  The fam calls me Martha as in "Stewart".  I love to cook.  I wonder how long recoup time is for surgery?  My PS said 4 - 6 weeks; my BS said 6 - 8 weeks.  Any thoughts? Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2012 12:35PM Wendymartha1 wrote: JeniferMiya, I too had what seemed like a "fever" in my lump area.  I went to the BS to have her examine me and she told me that my hot spot / burning / pain sensation was the result of the two core needle biopsies I had two weeks prior.  She said there was blood and other fluid draining out through the lymph nodes (my burning was under my arm).  Also swelling.  I did not have redness though.  It did go away after a few days.  Good luck with your surgery this Thursday - I will be right there with ya - my bag is packed already! A question for you post-surgery gals...did anyone have a spinal block in addition to general anesthesia?  My girlfriend had this and it scares the living daylights out of me.  My next step is to cut off my 10 inches of long hair knowing that chemo is coming - but I have decided to donate it...it somehow makes this aspect of cancer bearable. Thanks for all of your posts - many prayers for continued healing and recovery. Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2012 03:40AM Wendymartha1 wrote: JeniferMiya Wow yes you right - we do have the same schedule this week.  How Ironic!  But I would much rather be in Florida instead of New York (no sun and cold).  I hope that your pre-op visit goes well today.  I posted on another board about the SNB.  I called the BS and asked for some numbing creme - they don't routinely offer it!  Good luck this week to you.  Now things are really moving along! Healing wishes to everyone else who is recouperating and having surgery soon... Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2012 07:19PM Wendymartha1 wrote: JeniferMiya - Yes...we have the same surgery date, just 5 more to go!  I have been waiting over a month and love that the cancer is being removed soon.  The wait has been awful and I worry that things are growing and spreading.  Paula - I am a Christian too and have appreciated your scripture.  I am keeping those that my "sisters"  are giving me on note cards and putting them into a photo album of sorts.  My spiritual life has been shaken up as much as my body has. Thanks to everyone for posting about the dye...I love the analogy of bee stings! And the continued post-surgical tips have been my guide...the docs don't share much it seems. Another question...has anyone had a visiting nurse to handle the drains for a few days?  I think I have that option but am not sure how helpful it will be.  My DH and my Mom will be with me. Thanks everyone... Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2012 06:10PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Hi Everyone, I am so encouraged by your strength and courage!  Congrats to all who have done so well post-surgery!  Great job.  My surgery is one week from today.  My BS is having me do the dye injection the day before the surgery.  She said that the dye would be a long-lasting dye so she could see the coloration the following morning during surgery.  Has anyone had the injection the afternoon / evening before surgery?  Also, is the injection super painful?  I'm doing it as an outpatient appointment.  Thanks, Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 22, 2012 05:41PM Wendymartha1 wrote: CindyLooWho, Good luck....you will do great.  I love your meal.  It inspires me to have my favorite meal on Wed. evening prior to my surgery.  Way to go!  My line up is fast approaching.  Pre-op hospital visit tomorrow, SNB injection Wednesday, and BMX Thursday.  I can't wait to get "it" out! Thoughts and prayers to everyone else who is having surgery this week. Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 24, 2012 05:11PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Thank you so much everyone for the well wishes.  In exactly 12 hours the surgery begins.  Don't know if I will sleep at all tonight.  Did anyone sleep the night before at all?  I have a xanex but I doubt that will help.  I have lots of help - DH and parents and my church family.  Now I just need bravery.  You ladies have helped so very much! Paula God is good!  I have been seeing His works in numerous ways thus far... mgdsmc good job in finding a PS!  It seems like you have lots of strength and courage and go get what you need!  JeniferMiya good luck to you tomorrow.  I hope all of your appointments over the past few days went well. Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2012 07:03PM Wendymartha1 wrote: It has taken me a bit to post - I am now one week post BMX.  It was much tougher than I expected, but doable.  Today I had 3 of 4 drains removed; tomorrow I see the BS for what I am thinking are pathology results.  They only took 2 sentinal nodes out and never used  the blue dye - just the radioactive isotope the day before surgery.  I just have to trust that they knew what they were doing :-).  The only real complication came four days post surgery when I developed an impacted stool.  I was not aware that drains and anti-nausea meds combined with the narcotics could get one into real trouble constipation wise.  I had tried all sorts of OTC softeners, fiber drinks, laxatives, etc. and nothing worked.  So I had to resort to extreme measures (Fleet X 3) and finally am pain free.  . Paula, Connie, CindyLooWho and Mgdsmc and other October gals - thank you for your updates and regular posts.  They have helped me in enormous ways in preparation for my late October surgery.  You are all SO brave!!  And prayers for you all to continually heal and progress in your treatment.  Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Nov 2, 2012 06:25PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Paula, Glad to hear that the drain removal wasn't too bad.  I had 3 removed on Wednesay and 1 will be removed on Monday.  It was not painful for me at all - just an odd feeling running throughout my breast.  I was happy :-). Blessings and His peace to you, Wendy
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2012 05:52PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Keetmom - I know how you feel.  I said to my whole family at Thanksgiving:  "This is probably the last big meal I will eat for a while".  I start chemo on Tuesday.  I've already lost 13 pounds since DX and have been trying to gain in preparation for chemo.  I'm scared about chemo and also am wondering if I can return to work, which I am scheduled to do on December 7th.  My port was put in yesterday and it hurts too. JeniferMaya - so sorry about your day and trouble with neighbors and your mom.  It seems like since BC there are so many bad days.  Girls keep talking about adjusting to a "new normal".  That's what I am trying to do, and savor good days.  I know what you mean about "quiet".  I have refused visitors for 4 weeks since my BMX and feel anxious when I am around people other than immediate family.  These things will get better.... Wendy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2012 08:40AM Wendymartha1 wrote: Lizzie ~ day 1 and 2 of the port I was beside myself.  It hurt so much and I, like you, had been in a great walking mode two weeks post BMX.  The port doc said no walking, no physical therapy - nothing!  It felt like I took 3 steps back.  Pain meds were not helping either.  But here I am on day 4 and I barely feel it! I resumed my walking.   Last night I slept on the port side with no pain whatsoever!  My onc nurse said that the port is the way to go!  I have a Cat scan scheduled Monday but am afraid to ask them to access it then.  I want it to heal up a bit more.  So hang in there - the pain should go away. Wendy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2012 07:58PM Wendymartha1 wrote: I start on Tuesday morning.  The plan is for ACT but I want to talk with onc one more time before the "juice" goes in.    I'm scared of all the SE's but have a whole stash of OTC meds in my purse.  I am getting the chemo cut the day after with a wig fitting.  Re:  foods - is anyone doing juicing during chemo (fresh fruits and vegetables)?  I buy organic but don't know about bacteria. Good luck other first time gals. Hugs, Wendy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2012 05:29PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Hello everyone.  I was a first dose chemo gal on Tuesday.  Had the chemo cut on Wednesday and purchased a wig.  Tuesday night and Wednesday I had horrible nausea.  I had an arsenol of four medications but am still dizzy and nauseaous four days later.  I am trying to walk and do some house chores but it is difficult.  I visited work yesterday; MO suggested I stay out at least the whole first round to see how I do.  Also a CT scan of the lung showed "nodules" of less than 1mm.  They can't rule out cancer and can't say the nodules are benign.  Has anyone else had this happen?  The MO said that we will just repeat the scan in a few months.  Thanks ladies for your sharing! Wendy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2012 05:01PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Bea, I was in a similar situation.  Had a double mastectomy, stage II, and technically node negative (isolated tumor cells found in one sentinel node).  The Breast Center kept telling me I may not need or benefit from chemo.  However, I researched my situation extensively....given that 2 tumors were found (multi-focal), and the largest tumor was 3.7 cm, I decided to find an MO who would start chemo asap.  I went with a more aggressive plan; I am 45 and wanted to do everything I could.  I'm still waiting for Oncotype results that the Breast Clinic ordered but even a low score would not have changed my mind.  Wendy
Posts.Title: Starting chemo November 2012 michellej1980 IamNancy

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2012 06:41PM Wendymartha1 wrote: Thanks ladies for your posts.  I'm new here; scheduled to start chemotherapy on 11/27.  The most frustrating part has been choosing a chemo plan.  I have had three MO consults and they all recommend something different!  I tentatively chose ACT but will talk it over again with the MO I have chosen.  I will be one of the working gals; at least part-time.  Wishing you all well. Wendy
